incoming.deadline: One month prior to the first day of term (e.g. August 1 for Fall Term; December 1 for Winter Term)
instructions: For detailed instructions for students at another university wishing to participate in a UAlberta course through the WDA, please see this page. The following information reflects practical experience of recent PIMS Network Wide Courses students.

Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures, then submit the form to UA department.  By signing the WDA form, the student's home department is providing written assurance that the course(s) listed on the form: (a) is not available at the home university; (b) is required for the student's program; and (c) will be credited toward the student's graduate degree program upon successful completion.

For courses taken at the University of Alberta, students will be assessed only Non-Instructional fees by the University of Alberta. If a course requires additional expenses under University of Alberta policy, the department will require that the student pay these. See the UAlberta Tuition + Fees page for current fees and details. Students are strongly encouraged to investigate possible exemption procedures with the contacts listed above, well in advance of the registration deadline.

outgoing.deadline: One month prior to the first day of term (e.g. August 1 for Fall Term; December 1 for Winter Term)
instructions: For detailed instructions for students at UAlberta wishing to participate in a WDA course at another university, please see this page. The information below reflects practical experience of recent PIMS Network Wide Courses students.

Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures then submit it to host department. By approving the WDA application, the department at the University of Alberta is certifying that the course(s) listed on the form: (a) is not available at the University of Alberta; (b) is required for the student's program; and (c) will be credited to the student's graduate degree program upon successful completion with a satisfactory grade.

For each term of study under the WDA, the student will register at the University of Alberta in an Exchange (EXCH) course, which will be equivalent to the course weight registration at the university where the student is taking the course(s). The student will be assessed fees for that EXCH course at the University of Alberta. In accordance with the provisions of the WDA the student will be assessed general student fees, but no regular instructional fees by the university where the course(s) are being taken. If a course requires additional expenses, the university may require the student to pay these additional expenses.

instructions: Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures. Submit form to UBC department. Once approved, the student gets an acceptance email which includes information on how to opt-out of some of the student fees. A sample fee schedule can be found here. The total student fee is around $400. Any student can opt-out of the U-Pass, about $200 (students from SFU are automatically opted out because they get a U-Pass from SFU). Any student can opt out of medical insurance (IMED, about $100) but must state that they have other medical insurance (domestic students are automatically opted-out because it is assumed they have medical insurance from their home institution). This leaves a residual of about $100 that the student pays. Student is responsible for ordering an official transcript from UBC and have it sent to their home institution.

The following information reflects practical experience from PIMS Network Wide Graduate Course students.
1.  Fill out the WDA form
2.  Have your department fill out Part 1 under Home Institution.

outgoing.deadline: 4 weeks before the start of the course
instructions: Please see the UManitoba Program page and the UManitoba WDA FQA for up to date details. The following information reflects practical experience from PIMS Network Wide Graduate Course students.
1. Fill out the WDA form
2. Have your department fill out Part 1 under Home Institution.
3. Submit the form, along with a course description of the course you wish to take, to the UManitoba Faculty of Graduate Studies.
4. The Faculty of Graduate Studies will contact the Host Institution for their approval.

5. When the approval has been granted by the Host Institution, you will receive a Letter of Permission from the Registrar's Office at University of Manitoba.  You should also ensure that you have received an admission letter from the Host Institution and you are responsible for ensuring you are registered for the course at the Host Institution.  Students pay ancillary fees at the host institution (exemptions may apply).

6.  When the course has been completed and a grade assigned, please arrange to have an official transcript of marks from the Host Institution sent directly to the Registrar's Office, 400 University Centre, University of Manitoba.

instructions: Students applying to take courses at UVic under the Western Deans Agreement will be asked to submit an application for admission at uvic.ca/application. There is no application fee. More information found here.
Complete application form and obtain all 4 signatures. Students pay potential ancillary fees (see below).  Students are responsible for requesting an official transcript upon completion.
Complete the Graduate program update form
Obtain a copy of the course syllabus either from this site, or from the course instructor (UVic will request this information as part of the process)

UVic does not require completion of a regular application for admission and will waive the usual application fee. Once the WDA form is received in GARO with the appropriate signatures from the student’s home department and home graduate office, it will be forwarded to the department in which the course is offered, for approval.
The proposed host department is not obligated to accept the applicant. When returned to this office, it is given to the Director of GARO for final approval.
You will receive a letter indicating the outcome of your request. You will be registered in the course(s) upon approval.
Students pay ancillary fees (around $80 after opt out in previous years, but see this page for details).

If approval is given, the form will be sent directly to the host institution for their approvals.
Contact the potential host institution for details as soon as you receive verbal approval from your supervisor.  Students pay potential ancillary fees.
